- *For the monster in [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), see [Abominable Snowman (notdNetHack)](/wiki/Abominable_Snowman_\(notdNetHack\) "Abominable Snowman (notdNetHack)").*

The **Abominable Snowman**, Y, is a unique [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"). The Abominable Snowman is a [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned") [apelike creature](/wiki/Apelike_creature "Apelike creature") that has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), enhanced [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration"), can [swim](/wiki/Swim "Swim"), is capable of lifting and throwing [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder"), and can freeze [pools](/wiki/Pool "Pool") of water underneath it as it moves.

The Abominable Snowman has a strong bite attack, a strong weapon attack, and a strong claw attack that can knock targets back, and may go [berserk](/wiki/Berserk_\(EvilHack\) "Berserk (EvilHack)") when its [HP](/wiki/HP "HP") is low enough. It possesses [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance"), [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), and is [vulnerable](/wiki/Vulnerable "Vulnerable") to [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire").

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") the Abominable Snowman's [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") grants +55% (11⁄20) [additional cold resistance](/wiki/Partial_intrinsic "Partial intrinsic").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Origin](#Origin)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

The Abominable Snowman appears on the second floor of the [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm"), where it is generated in the middle of the gorge's narrow pass on level creation. It is [always generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a dozen boulders in its inventory.

## Strategy

The Abominable Snowman's ice power makes it immune to [drowning](/wiki/Drowning "Drowning"), and the boulders it will pelt you with can obstruct the pass. It is typically worth keeping a [wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking") or two around so that non-[giant](/wiki/Giant_\(starting_race\) "Giant (starting race)") characters can break them and pass by; casters such as [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") can also try the [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh") spell.

## Origin

The Abominable Snowman is also known as the [Yeti](/wiki/Yeti "Yeti"), an iconic cryptozoological animal said to inhabit the Himalayan region of Nepal and Tibet. Folklorists trace the origin of the Yeti to a combination of factors, including the folklore of pre-Buddhist Himalayan cultures such as the [Sherpa people](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sherpa_people "wikipedia:Sherpa people"), and misidentified fauna such as bears or yak. The Abominable Snowman is often described as a large, bipedal ape-like creature that is covered with brown, gray, or white hair, and it is sometimes depicted as having large, sharp teeth.

## Encyclopedia entry

The Abominable Snowman, or yeti, is one of the truly great  
unknown animals of the twentieth century. It is a large hairy  
biped that lives in the Himalayan region of Asia ... The story  
of the Abominable Snowman is filled with mysteries great and  
small, and one of the most difficult of all is how it got that  
awful name. The creature is neither particularly abominable,  
nor does it necessarily live in the snows. \_Yeti\_ is a Tibetan  
word which may apply either to a real, but unknown animal of  
the Himalayas, or to a mountain spirit or demon -- no one is  
quite sure which. And after nearly half a century in which  
Westerners have trampled around looking for the yeti, and  
asking all sorts of questions, the original native traditions  
concerning the creature have become even more muddled and  
confused.  
\[ The Encyclopedia of Monsters, by Daniel Cohen ]

Abominable Snowman (EvilHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Y Abominable Snowman (No tile)
Difficulty 27
Attacks Bite 8d4, Weapon 6d6, Claw 6d6 knock-back damage
Y Abominable Snowman (No tile)
Difficulty 27
Attacks

Bite 8d4, Weapon 6d6, Claw 6d6 knock-back damage

Base level 25
Base experience 963
Speed 12
Base AC 0
Base MR 50
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) Unique
Genocidable No
Weight 5000
Nutritional value 2000
Size Gigantic
Resistances sleep,poison,petrification,cold
Resistances conveyed cold (100%)

The Abominable Snowman:

  • can swim.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is an animal.
  • regenerates HP quickly.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can throw boulders.
  • has infravision.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 2636
For the monster in notdNetHack, see Abominable Snowman (notdNetHack).

The Abominable Snowman, Y, is a unique monster that appears in EvilHack. The Abominable Snowman is a thick-skinned apelike creature that has infravision, enhanced regeneration, can swim, is capable of lifting and throwing boulders, and can freeze pools of water underneath it as it moves.

The Abominable Snowman has a strong bite attack, a strong weapon attack, and a strong claw attack that can knock targets back, and may go berserk when its HP is low enough. It possesses sleep resistance, poison resistance, stoning resistance, cold resistance, and is vulnerable to fire.

Eating the Abominable Snowman's corpse or tin grants +55% (11⁄20) additional cold resistance.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Origin
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry

Generation

The Abominable Snowman appears on the second floor of the Ice Queen's Realm, where it is generated in the middle of the gorge's narrow pass on level creation. It is always generated with a dozen boulders in its inventory.

Strategy

The Abominable Snowman's ice power makes it immune to drowning, and the boulders it will pelt you with can obstruct the pass. It is typically worth keeping a wand of striking or two around so that non-giant characters can break them and pass by; casters such as Healers can also try the stone to flesh spell.

Origin

The Abominable Snowman is also known as the Yeti, an iconic cryptozoological animal said to inhabit the Himalayan region of Nepal and Tibet. Folklorists trace the origin of the Yeti to a combination of factors, including the folklore of pre-Buddhist Himalayan cultures such as the Sherpa people, and misidentified fauna such as bears or yak. The Abominable Snowman is often described as a large, bipedal ape-like creature that is covered with brown, gray, or white hair, and it is sometimes depicted as having large, sharp teeth.

Encyclopedia entry

The Abominable Snowman, or yeti, is one of the truly great
unknown animals of the twentieth century. It is a large hairy
biped that lives in the Himalayan region of Asia ... The story
of the Abominable Snowman is filled with mysteries great and
small, and one of the most difficult of all is how it got that
awful name. The creature is neither particularly abominable,
nor does it necessarily live in the snows. _Yeti_ is a Tibetan
word which may apply either to a real, but unknown animal of
the Himalayas, or to a mountain spirit or demon -- no one is
quite sure which. And after nearly half a century in which
Westerners have trampled around looking for the yeti, and
asking all sorts of questions, the original native traditions
concerning the creature have become even more muddled and
confused.
[ The Encyclopedia of Monsters, by Daniel Cohen ]

The '''Abominable Snowman''', {{brightcyan|Y}}, is a unique [[monster]] that appears in [[EvilHack]]. The Abominable Snowman is a [[thick-skinned]] [[apelike creature]] that has [[infravision]], enhanced [[regeneration]], can [[swim]], is capable of lifting and throwing [[boulder]]s, and can freeze [[pool]]s of water underneath it as it moves.

The Abominable Snowman has a strong bite attack, a strong weapon attack, and a strong claw attack that can knock targets back, and may go [[Berserk (EvilHack)|berserk]] when its [[HP]] is low enough. It possesses [[sleep resistance]], [[poison resistance]], [[stoning resistance]], [[cold resistance]], and is [[vulnerable]] to [[fire]].

[[Eating]] the Abominable Snowman's [[corpse]] or [[tin]] grants +55% ({{frac|11|20}}) [[Partial intrinsic|additional cold resistance]].

==Generation==
The Abominable Snowman appears on the second floor of the [[Ice Queen's Realm]], where it is generated in the middle of the gorge's narrow pass on level creation. It is [[monster starting inventory|always generated with]] a dozen boulders in its inventory.

==Strategy==
The Abominable Snowman's ice power makes it immune to [[drowning]], and the boulders it will pelt you with can obstruct the pass. It is typically worth keeping a [[wand of striking]] or two around so that non-[[Giant (starting race)|giant]] characters can break them and pass by; casters such as [[Healer]]s can also try the [[stone to flesh]] spell.

==Origin==
The Abominable Snowman is also known as the [[Yeti]], an iconic cryptozoological animal said to inhabit the Himalayan region of Nepal and Tibet. Folklorists trace the origin of the Yeti to a combination of factors, including the folklore of pre-Buddhist Himalayan cultures such as the [[wikipedia:Sherpa people|Sherpa people]], and misidentified fauna such as bears or yak. The Abominable Snowman is often described as a large, bipedal ape-like creature that is covered with brown, gray, or white hair, and it is sometimes depicted as having large, sharp teeth.

==Encyclopedia entry==
